data.title: Home
data.text:
International Self-Care Day: July 24

by Kayla Bell

On July 24th, the world comes together to celebrate International Self-Care Day, a global recognition of the vital importance of prioritizing one’s well-being. This day serves as a powerful reminder that taking care of oneself isn’t selfish; it’s essential for leading a fulfilling and balanced life. READ MORE

Steps to Cultivating Self-Love & Acceptance

by Kayla Bell

Self-love, often misunderstood as narcissism, is the foundation of a fulfilling life. It’s about accepting oneself unconditionally, flaws and all, and treating oneself with kindness and compassion. READ MORE

The Benefits of Vacationing

by Kayla Bell

Vacations are essential for overall well-being. They serve as a crucial antidote to the relentless pace of modern life, offering a much-needed respite from daily stressors. READ MORE

How To: Developing a Productive Morning Routine

by Kayla Bell

Word of the Day: Quixotic

by Kayla Bell

Quixotic is an adjective used to describe someone or something that is foolishly impractical, especially in the pursuit of ideals. It often implies a touch of romantic idealism or a tendency to act on extravagant or chivalrous impulses without regard for practicality. READ MORE

Thoughts While Shaving

July 2024 … Our weather forecast is for more hot weather … Highs in the low 90s today … chance of rain … 80%. Tonight … mostly cloudy with a low around 74 … and a 60% chance of rain…

Being a huge sports fan … Enjoy checking in on the local, state and national events … Locally, high school football practice begins soon … The start of the 2024 Paris Olympics is just days away … READ MORE

3 Things To Know For Wednesday

1. Project Uplift Excellence Black-Tie Scholarship Gala: Saturday, 7-10 p.m., Ballroom at Whimsical, 314 South Poplar Street, Elizabethtown.

2. Yard Sale and Farmers Market: Aug. 3, 8 a.m.-noon, Camp Clearwater, 2038 White Lake Drive, White Lake.

3. True Story of Smokey Bear: Aug. 10, 2-3 p.m., Turnbull Creek Educational State Forest, 4803 Sweet Home Church Road, Elizabethtown. READ MORE

• BLADEN ONLINE’S COMMUNITY CALENDAR

This Day in History For July 24

1961 – Beginning of a trend, a United States commercial airplane is hijacked to Cuba.

1969 – Apollo 11 returns to Earth after taking the first astronauts to the moon and returning them safely.

2019 – Facebook agrees to pay a $5 billion fine, largest ever for violating consumer privacy, to the Federal Trade Commission. READ MORE

STORIES FROM TUESDAY, JULY 23

CLOSURE NOTICE: Mercer Mill Brown Marsh Road (SR 1700) and Elwell Ferry

Contributed

Bladen County, NC – July 23, 2024: According to Bridget Ellison with the North Carolina Department of Transportation Bladen County Maintenance, Mercer Mill Brown Marsh Road (SR 1700) will be closed north of Harrelson Road (1711) starting Tuesday, July 23rd at 8:00 AM through Tuesday, July 30th at 5:00 PM. This closure is necessary for crossline replacement. READ MORE

Weekly Horoscope: July 22 – July 28

by Kayla Bell

Cancer (June 21 – July 22): Cancers, the nurturers of the zodiac, might find themselves needing to choose their words with extra care this week. Before launching into an impassioned speech, consider the potential consequences. READ MORE

Recipe of the Day: French Toast

by Kayla Bell

French toast, a timeless breakfast favorite, is more than just a simple dish of soaked bread and eggs. It’s a canvas for creativity, a comforting hug on a plate, and the perfect way to start a lazy weekend morning. READ MORE

10 Fun Facts of the Day: Broadway

by Kayla Bell

The bright lights, the booming voices, the captivating stories – Broadway has captivated audiences for over 170 years. But beyond the glitz and glamour, there’s a treasure trove of fascinating stories and surprising facts waiting to be discovered. READ MORE

Word of the Day: Luminous

by Kayla Bell

Today’s word of the day is “luminous,” a word that evokes a sense of brightness and radiance. But its meaning extends beyond the physical realm, encompassing intellectual brilliance and captivating qualities. READ MORE

Thoughts While Shaving

High temp Monday … near 89 degrees and over an inch of rain throughout the day … a slow drizzle before midnight … All much needed…

Topic of politics picking up, as one would expect … Both parties … Interesting times … Not likely to change much with the election set for early November … The money is flowing … READ MORE

STORIES FROM MONDAY, JULY 22

10 Fun Facts of the Day: The Seven Wonders of the World

by Kayla Bell

The Seven Wonders of the World have captivated imaginations for centuries. These awe-inspiring structures, both ancient and modern, stand as testaments to human ingenuity and artistry. READ MORE

Self-Care Tips for Parents & Caregivers

by Kayla Bell

Being a parent or caregiver is an incredibly rewarding yet demanding role.

It requires a constant outpouring of love, patience, and energy. READ MORE

10 Fun Facts of the Day: Historical Oddities

by Kayla Bell

History isn’t all about memorizing dates and battles.

Sometimes, the most fascinating stories lie in the unexpected quirks and oddities that have shaped the world we live in today. READ MORE

How To: Planning a Family Picnic

by Kayla Bell

Family picnics are a delightful way to break away from the routine and reconnect with loved ones in a relaxed, natural setting. Beyond the delicious food and fresh air, picnics offer an opportunity to create lasting memories through shared laughter, games, and simply enjoying each other’s company. READ MORE

Thoughts While Shaving

Sunday … I listened to a very good sermon … then it was like the world began to change right before my eyes…

Participated in a very good worship service … enjoyed a good meal with some of my favorites … Turned the TV on and the world was changing right before my eyes… READ MORE

STORIES FROM SUNDAY, JULY 21

Five Bible Verses and More Rest Assured, Israel Will Win

by Van Yandell

Genesis 12:2 and 7

“And I will make of thee a great nation, and I will bless thee, and make thy name great; and thou shalt be a blessing: (7) And the LORD appeared unto Abram, and said, unto thy seed will I give this land: and there built he an altar unto the LORD.” READ MORE

Five Bible Verses and More – Not Only a Religion, But Essential Knowledge

Contributed

1 Timothy 3:16 states, “All scripture is given by inspiration of God,” highlighting the foundational belief in the Bible’s divine origin. Recently, Oklahoma passed a law mandating the teaching of the Bible in classrooms, sparking debate not about establishing a state religion or promoting Christian nationalism, but about the educational benefits it offers. READ MORE

Movie Review: Twisters (2024)

A staff report

Genre: Action/Adventure, Suspense/Thriller

Release Date: Friday, July 19, 2024

Director: Steven Harper

Starring: Edgar-Jones, Powell, Ramos

Rating: ★★★★☆

As storm season sweeps across the silver screen in “Twisters”, director Steven Harper delivers a gripping tale of adrenaline-fueled action set against the tumultuous backdrop of Oklahoma’s tornado alley. With an impressive 80% fresh rating on the Tomatometer, this film promises a thrilling ride for audiences seeking heart-pounding suspense and breathtaking visual effects. READ MORE

Movie Review: The Fall Guy – Action-Packed Nostalgia with a Modern Twist

A staff report

Director: David Leitch

Writer: Drew Pearce

Cast: Ryan Gosling, Emily Blunt, Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Hannah Waddingham, Teresa Palmer, Stephanie Hsu, Winston Duke, Ben Knight, Lee Majors, Heather Thomas, Jason Momoa

The Fall Guy, directed by David Leitch and written by Drew Pearce, is a 2024 American action comedy that breathes new life into the beloved 1980s TV series. With a star-studded cast led by Ryan Gosling and Emily Blunt, the film offers a blend of action, comedy, and romance, making it a thrilling ride for audiences. READ MORE

Recipe of the Day: Apple Turnover

by Kayla Bell

Golden, flaky pastry encasing warm, spiced apples – apple turnovers are a delightful handheld treat perfect for breakfast, dessert, or a satisfying snack. This recipe offers a simple and delicious way to enjoy the comforting flavors of fall any time of year. READ MORE

Recipe of the Day: Sushi Rolls

by Kayla Bell

Sushi rolls, those delightful bundles of seaweed filled with fluffy rice and flavorful fillings, have become a global culinary phenomenon. While a trip to your favorite sushi restaurant is always tempting, there’s a certain satisfaction in creating these delectable rolls at home. READ MORE

Thoughts While Shaving

Rose early this AM, ’bout midnight, and I heard the pitter-patter of rain … Oh so brief … Total shower measured … maybe a trace … The temperature was near 78 degrees … And the rain ceased …

Yesterday was a good day for our small Hester family … my bride and I, plus 2 sons … and we all had a brief time together Saturday … Always good… READ MORE

STORIES FROM SATURDAY, JULY 20

Bladen County Benefits from a Half-Century of Commitment with Eddie White of State Farm

By Charlotte Smith

Bladen County, North Carolina, has long been a blend of tightly-knit communities and hometown values. Few have woven themselves into the “Mother County” fabric as Eddie White, State Farm Agent, has in Elizabethtown. Celebrating an astonishing fifty years in the insurance business, White’s journey from marine biology to the insurance world is a testament to his adaptive spirit and unyielding dedication. READ MORE

Recipe of the Day: Banana Bread

By Kayla Bell

There’s nothing quite like the aroma of freshly baked banana bread wafting through the kitchen. This timeless treat is more than just a delicious snack; it’s a warm hug on a plate, perfect for cozy mornings, afternoon pick-me-ups, or delightful dessert companions. Today, we’ll delve into a classic banana bread recipe that’s easy to follow and guaranteed to satisfy your sweet tooth. READ MORE

Word of the Day: Zenith

By Kayla Bell

Today, we delve into a word that evokes a sense of achievement and brilliance: zenith. Zenith, pronounced “zee-nith,” is a noun with two primary definitions. In astronomy, it refers to the highest point in the sky reached by a celestial body, such as the sun at noon. Imagine the arc the sun traces across the sky throughout the day. The zenith is the very peak of that arc, the point directly overhead. READ MORE

10 Fun Facts of the Day: Accidental Inventions

By Kayla Bell

Sometimes, the most brilliant inventions come about not through meticulous planning, but through sheer happenstance. These lucky discoveries, often born from mistakes or unexpected observations, have revolutionized our lives surprisingly. Buckle up and get ready for a dose of trivia as we explore 10 fun facts about accidental inventions! READ MORE

Bladen County Headlines… 50 Years Ago

*Bladen County Hospital approved a pest control contract with McDuffie Pest Control of Elizabethtown.

*North Carolina Highway Patrolman R.B. Starling arrested three men on marijuana charges. They were placed in Bladen County Jail with bond set at $500 each.

*The average Border Belt tobacco price was $81.42 per pound. Bladen growers were expecting prices $10 higher….and expressed their disappointment in the local media.

Thoughts While Shaving

Weather continues to get top billing … Yesterday’s high temp … 89 degrees in our area … no rainfall since we last reported, early Friday…

Whiteville native Brooks Baldwin made his 1st start in the baseball big leagues Friday night … 1st at bat … a single to right field vs. the Kansas City Royals …

Stock market took a ‘dive’ over the past few days … It has had a great run, earlier… READ MORE

By: Jair McElveen

Do you consider yourself a bookworm? Are you a history buff?

Well, if you answered yes to any of those questions, this event is for you. READ MORE

NCDHHS Celebrates Milestones and Invests in Behavioral Health Initiatives

Contributed

July 19, 2024 – Celebrating Two Years of 9-8-8

This week marks the second anniversary of the 988 Suicide and Crisis Lifeline, a vital service offered by the North Carolina Department of Health and Human Services (NCDHHS). The 988 Lifeline provides around-the-clock support for those experiencing mental health and substance use crises. READ MORE

Word of the Day: Sagacious

by Kayla Bell

Today’s word is “sagacious,” a powerful adjective that describes someone with exceptional wisdom and sound judgment. Sagacious individuals possess a deep understanding of people and situations, allowing them to navigate complex challenges with remarkable insight. READ MORE

10 Fun Facts of the Day: Weird Laws

by Kayla Bell

Laws are the foundation of a functioning society, establishing order and protecting citizens.

But sometimes, amidst the serious regulations, emerge some truly bizarre and unusual laws. READ MORE

The Role of Music in Enhancing Your Mental Health

by Kayla Bell

Music is a universal language, capable of stirring emotions, transporting us to different times and places, and even influencing our physical state. But beyond its entertainment value, music plays a crucial role in enhancing our mental health. READ MORE

Essential Kitchen Tools for Beginners

by Kayla Bell

Conquering the kitchen can feel daunting, especially for beginners. But fear not!

With a few essential tools, you’ll be whipping up delicious meals in no time. READ MORE

North Carolina’s June Employment Figures Released

A staff report

RALEIGH — The state’s seasonally adjusted June 2024 unemployment rate was 3.6 percent, unchanged from May’s revised rate. The national rate increased 0.1 of a percentage point to 4.1 percent. READ MORE

Thoughts While Shaving

And the rain came down … About 3 inches recorded at the local weather station between about 7:30 last evening and midnight … More rain than we have seen in several weeks/months … and welcomed…

Hope the same for all of Bladen, and nearby counties…

Rain is likely too late to do much for crops … hope I am wrong … but better late than never… READ MORE

STORIES FROM THURSDAY, JULY 18

Get Ready to Stomp, Sip, and Sway at the 18th Annual NC Grape Festival

A staff report

Dublin, NC – Get ready for a day filled with fun, music, and delicious flavors at the 18th Annual NC Grape Festival, hosted by Lu Mil Vineyard on October 12, 2024. The festival promises a memorable experience from 10:00am to 3:00pm. READ MORE

Celebrating a Century with Family: Lula Margaret Coatney McKoy

By: Jair McElveen

At 101 years of age, Lula Margaret Coatney Mckoy, fondly known as “Ma” to many, personifies the essence of family dedication and beloved traditions. In an interview with BladenOnline, Ma shared some information about her stunning life centered around family and family reunions, a tradition she has upheld without fail. READ MORE

How To: Successfully Changing Your Style

by Kayla Bell

Have you ever looked in the mirror and felt a disconnect between your clothes and who you are?

Maybe your style hasn’t evolved with your life, or perhaps you’re simply craving a change. READ MORE

How Technology is Transforming Self-Care Practices

by Kayla Bell

Self-care is no longer a luxury, it’s a necessity; but carving out time for relaxation and well-being can be a challenge.

Thankfully, technology is stepping in, offering a wave of innovative tools and resources that are transforming the way we approach self-care. READ MORE

Thoughts While Shaving

Another 92-plus day was recorded yesterday … at the local weather station … and no rain, locally … as of midnight, Wednesday…

The Republican convention winding down … VP candidate was speaker at last night’s event in Milwaukee.

On the Democratic side of the news … Late report indicated President Joe Biden tested positive for COVID … Not good for anyone … READ MORE

IN CASE YOU MISSED IT

Community Event: Walk for Life Hosted by The Mercy House

A staff report

Bladenboro, NC – The Mercy House is excited to announce the upcoming “Walk for Life” event, set to take place on September 7, 2024. This family-friendly event will be held at the Bladenboro Historical Building, located at 818 S Main St, Bladenboro, NC. READ MORE

Corrected: Camp Clearwater Presents Free Family Concert Featuring 2nd Chance Ministries

A staff report

White Lake, NC – Camp Clearwater and Clearwater Chapel are excited to announce a special live music event featuring Nashville recording artists, 2nd Chance Ministries. The concert, titled “I Believe in the Resurrection,” will take place on July 27th at 8:00 PM on the Camp Clearwater Main Stage. READ MORE

Community Alert: Hickory Grove Baptist Church Hosts Vital Blood Drive

A staff report

Bladenboro, NC – The American Red Cross is calling on community members to contribute to a crucial blood drive at Hickory Grove Baptist Church, located at 6414 Center Road, Bladenboro, NC 28320. This life-saving event is scheduled for Tuesday, August 6, 2024, from noon to 5:00 PM. READ MORE

16th Annual Tri-County Awards & Recognition Banquet to Celebrate Achievements in Riegelwood

Contributed

The Men and Women United for Youth & Families organization is set to host its 16th Annual Tri-County Awards and Recognition Banquet on Saturday, July 27, 2024, at 4:00 PM. The event will take place at the Berline P. Graham Multipurpose Building located at East Arcadia Elementary School, 21451 NC-87, Riegelwood, NC 28456. READ MORE

26th Annual “Made in the Shade” Open Car and Truck Show

A staff report

The Classic Cruisers Car Club of Elizabethtown, NC, is gearing up for its 26th Annual “Made in the Shade” Open Car and Truck Show. This annual event will take place on Saturday, August 10, 2024, at the San Jose Restaurant located across from Walmart at 1320 W. Broad Street, Elizabethtown, NC. READ MORE

Project Uplift Excellence Gala Honors Community Members

By: Jair McElveen

On July 27, 2024, the Whimsical Florist Ballroom will host the inaugural Project Uplift Excellence Black Tie Scholarship Gala, an event devoted to highlighting community leaders who do not get the acknowledgment they deserve. Leading this event Jerome Purdie, founder of the state-recognized and non-profit organization Project Uplift, prepares for a memorable night that will be full of recognition, community spirit, and charitable support. READ MORE

White Lake Fall Swim Challenge Set for September 7, 2024

A staff report

White Lake, NC – The highly anticipated White Lake Fall Swim Challenge is scheduled to take place on Saturday, September 7, 2024. This exciting event offers participants a choice of three swim distances, catering to various skill levels and preferences. READ MORE

Bladen Community College Hosts Back to School Blast for K-12 Students

A staff report
